Presenting Problem / Chief Complaint: The patient has been managing to keep up with everything and feels better due to dietary changes, leading to increased clarity and reduced irritability.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient feels raw about their mother's passing, experiencing harder days triggered by random reminders. They have found some healthy distractions like cooking and watching shows, but have also had moments of stress leading to emotional outbursts.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient is encouraged to practice a simple breathing exercise to manage stress and emotional reactions.
Next Steps: The patient agrees to try the breathing technique over the next week and will report back on its effectiveness.
